content:
Dr. Smith has taught me to catch myself when I'm thinking negative thoughts and to reframe them in a more realistic or positive way. For example, if I think "I'm a failure," I'll try to reframe it as "I made a mistake, but I can learn from it." It's not always easy, but it's getting better with practice.

I've also been trying to focus on the present moment and what I can control, rather than worrying about the future or past. It's helping me feel more grounded and centered. And like I mentioned earlier, yoga and meditation have been really helpful in reducing my anxiety levels and making me feel more calm.

I've also been trying to prioritize my needs and communicate them to others, which has been really liberating. It's hard for me to say no to people, but I'm getting better at it. Dr. Smith has been helping me work on setting healthy boundaries and prioritizing my own needs, which has been really
